newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU SEEKS UNCHANGED 1997/98 FARM PRICES, AID CUT.
newsitem.headline: EU SEEKS UNCHANGED 1997/98 FARM PRICES, AID CUT.

text.p: The European Commission on Wednesday proposed mostly unchanged farm prices in 1997/98 (July/June) but maintained its demand for a 1.4 billion Ecus cut in direct aid payments to cereals and oilseed farmers.
"Apart from some minor exceptions, the proposal is to maintain existing prices and market measures," a Commission source said.

The Commission last summer proposed a cut in aid payments to cereals, oilseeds and protein crop farmers to help fund emergency aid for beef producers hit by the "mad cow disease" crisis. The proposal was dropped by farm ministers in October.

The revived plan would involve cereals and oilseed cuts of 7.3 and 4.2 percent respectively, as well as a 27 percent cut in aid for land set-aside. In addition, the Commission has proposed savings of 82 million Ecus.
The savings would be achieved through lower monthly increases in intervention cereals and rice storage payments, which would be cut in line with lower interest rates.

Flax area aid payments would be cut by 5.7 percent to 815.86 Ecus per hectare and the hemp area aid cut by 7.5 percent to 716.63 Ecus per ha. A flax levy of 49.62 Ecus a tonne would be reduced to zero.
